mods.note: Telegram - XX. ■ iW From To No. Dated & Reed. - britconsul, Bushire. Political, Muscat. -do- Bahrain. Political Agent to give copy to • 3.N.O.P.G. Reference Residency P.L.No.61 of 454. 20.1.1933* 6th June 1936. Persian Government have protested to Legation Tehran regarding Bahrain Saudi transit duties agreement on the grounds of Persian claim to Bahrain. 2. v I have no reason to believe that Persian Government have any intention of aggression but in case Persian sloops visit your port please refer to corres pondence ending with Bahrain letter No. C-66 of February 13th 1933 (to Kuwait .and Muscat anuer Residency Printed Letter No. 620-S of 7th June 1933) for guidance as to what action you have to take. -BRITCONSUL-CONFIDENTIAL♦ ■—i No*903-£ of 1937 Residency and Consulate General Bushire, the 29th December 1937 ent, Muscat*^ The Political Agent, Bahrain. The Political Agent, Kuwait. O Subject ; Visits of Persian Warships to Arab ports. Meffiorapd.ym. Reference correspondence ending with Residency Endorsement No.$67-8 of 27th December 1932. 2. I have no reason to believe that Iranian sloops intend visiting the Arab side but it might be as well for you to refresh your mind by reference to the above corres pondence. Sd. T.C. Fowle, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. ATTESTED . pJ0 for Secretary to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9/21 Persian navy: activities and visits to Arab ports'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order, from the front to the rear.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 4, these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence from the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf to the Political Agent, Muscat. The papers warn of possible visits by Iranian sloops and give reference to previous correspondence (see IOR/R/15/6/319) on what action to take if such visits occur.
